title: Mechanical Watch: Exploded View
summary:
This article details the author's journey to create a physical, exploded view model of a mechanical watch movement, inspired by interactive illustrations from Bartosz Ciechanowski's blog. Frustrated by the lack of existing models, the author, despite lacking specific expertise, embarks on a project to build one themselves.

The process begins with exploring different watch movement types, opting for simpler pocketwatch movements due to their larger components. The initial approach involves layered resin casting, which proves problematic due to visible seams, messy application, and bubble formation. Abandoning layered casting, the author switches to suspending each component individually using fishing line within a single resin cast.

The author experiments with various resins, vacuum pumps for bubble removal, and CA glue for assembly, mimicking watchmaking techniques. Prototype #1 highlights the fishing line's minimal visibility but reveals the unsuitability of cylindrical casts. Prototype #2 introduces a structured process: disassembly, cleaning, train wheel assembly, and step-by-step component suspension. The dial side is assembled similarly, and a mold is created for resin casting.

Challenges in Prototype #2 include subassembly attachment and resin shrinkage due to overheating. To address these, Prototype #3 incorporates a scissor lift lab jack for precise component placement and a magnet for holding screws. The goal is to create a visually clear and accurate exploded view model, overcoming technical hurdles along the way.

chinese_summary:

作者试验了各种树脂、用于去除气泡的真空泵和用于组装的CA胶，模仿了制表技术。1号原型展示了鱼线的最小可见性，但也揭示了圆柱形铸件的不适用性。2号原型引入了一个结构化的流程：拆卸、清洁、齿轮系组装以及逐步的组件悬挂。表盘侧的组装方式类似，并创建了一个用于树脂浇注的模具。

title: Git Notes: Git's coolest, most unloved­ feature (2022)
summary:
This article discusses Git notes, a powerful but often overlooked feature of Git that allows users to attach metadata to Git objects like commits, blobs, and trees without modifying the objects themselves. Git notes can be used to track information such as code review status, testing results, time spent on a commit, or discussions on mailing lists.

The article highlights practical use cases, including the Git project itself using notes to link commits to mailing list discussions and the `reviewnotes` plugin for Gerrit, which allows developers to view code review information directly in Git log. It also mentions `git-appraise`, a fully distributed code review system built on Git notes.

Despite their potential, Git notes suffer from poor usability and limited adoption. GitHub stopped displaying commit notes in 2014. The author points out that working with notes for blobs or trees requires delving into Git's plumbing, making them inaccessible to many users.

Despite the challenges, the author argues that Git notes offer a path toward forge independence by enabling the distribution of project history and metadata alongside the code itself, without relying on platforms like GitHub or GitLab. He concludes that if Git notes were more user-friendly, they could unlock a more distributed and collaborative approach to software development.

LibRedirect covers a vast range of websites, including platforms for video, social media, music, content sharing, code hosting, reference materials, translation, and more. The goal is to provide users with greater control over their data and online privacy by utilizing these alternative services. title: TPU Deep Dive
summary:
This article provides a deep dive into the architecture and design philosophy of Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs), contrasting them with GPUs. TPUs prioritize scalability, energy efficiency, and high matrix multiplication throughput through hardware-software co-design, leveraging systolic arrays and Ahead-of-Time (AoT) compilation.

At the chip level (TPUv4 as an example), a TPU features two TensorCores, each containing a Matrix Multiply Unit (MXU), Vector Unit (VPU), and dedicated memory buffers (VMEM, SMEM). Unlike GPUs with numerous smaller cores and extensive caching, TPUs feature larger on-chip memory and smaller HBM, emphasizing efficient dataflow through systolic arrays.

The design philosophy revolves around systolic arrays for efficient matrix operations and AoT compilation via the XLA compiler to minimize energy-intensive cache accesses. XLA analyzes computation graphs in advance, enabling optimized, cache-less execution. This contrasts with GPUs' flexibility.

TPUs achieve scalability through multi-chip configurations. Trays (boards) contain 4 chips, racks consist of 64 chips arranged in a 3D torus network, and Superpods (full pods) contain thousands of chips (e.g., 4096 in TPUv4, 9216 in TPUv7). Optical Circuit Switching (OCS) connects racks, enabling wraparound communication and the creation of non-contiguous TPU Slices (subsets of a pod), enhancing operational stability and flexibility in resource allocation. Different slice topologies (cube, cigar, rectangle) can be configured to optimize performance for different parallelism strategies (data, tensor, pipeline).
chinese_title: TPU深度解析
chinese_summary:
本文深入探讨谷歌张量处理器（TPU）的架构和设计理念，并将其与GPU进行对比。TPU通过软硬件协同设计，利用脉动阵列和提前编译（AoT），优先考虑可扩展性、能源效率和高矩阵乘法吞吐量。

以芯片级别（例如TPUv4）为例，TPU具有两个TensorCore，每个TensorCore包含一个矩阵乘法单元（MXU）、向量单元（VPU）和专用内存缓冲区（VMEM、SMEM）。与拥有大量较小内核和广泛缓存的GPU不同，TPU具有更大的片上内存和更小的HBM，强调通过脉动阵列实现高效的数据流。

设计理念围绕用于高效矩阵运算的脉动阵列以及通过XLA编译器进行AoT编译，以最大限度地减少能量密集型缓存访问。XLA预先分析计算图，从而实现优化的无缓存执行。这与GPU的灵活性形成对比。

TPU通过多芯片配置实现可扩展性。托盘（板）包含4个芯片，机架由64个芯片组成，排列在3D环形网络中，超级集群（完整集群）包含数千个芯片（例如，TPUv4中的4096个，TPUv7中的9216个）。光路交换（OCS）连接机架，从而实现环绕通信，并创建非连续的TPU切片（集群的子集），从而提高运营稳定性和资源分配的灵活性。可以配置不同的切片拓扑（立方体、雪茄形、矩形），以优化不同并行策略（数据、张量、流水线）的性能。

title: How to negotiate your salary package
summary:
This article provides a comprehensive guide to salary negotiation, primarily targeted toward engineers and technical professionals who are uncomfortable with the process. It emphasizes that salary negotiation is crucial and can have a significant impact on long-term earnings and career trajectory.

The author argues that people often have a negative mindset towards negotiation, viewing it as distasteful or unnecessary, which is a disadvantage in the professional world. The piece encourages readers to shift their perspective, recognizing that negotiation is a common practice among successful individuals.

Key points include:

*   **Negotiation is vital:** Small differences in salary can compound over time, leading to substantial financial gains.
*   **Mindset shift:** Overcome the discomfort of negotiation by understanding its importance and embracing it as a skill.
*   **Employer's perspective:** Recognize that companies view employees in terms of fully loaded costs (salary, benefits, taxes), making smaller salary increases less significant to them.

*   **Don't give a number first**: Make the company make the first offer.

title: Allocators Are Monkeys with Typewriters
summary:
This article explores the creation of a simple memory allocator that manages a pre-allocated memory region, inspired by a limitation in Microsoft's mimalloc. The author humorously suggests that building a basic allocator is achievable even with limited expertise, hence the title.

The core concept revolves around understanding the allocator's role in allocating, deallocating, and reallocating memory, mimicking the functionality of standard C library functions like `malloc`, `free`, and `resize`. A key challenge allocators address is memory fragmentation, both internal (wasted space within allocated blocks) and external (small, unusable free blocks scattered throughout memory).

The article focuses on implementing a "buddy system" allocator, a relatively simple and reliable method also utilized by the Linux kernel. This system works by recursively dividing a contiguous memory chunk into halves (buddies) until a suitable size is found for the requested allocation. While effective, this method can lead to internal fragmentation.

The author explains allocation and deallocation in the buddy system with an example, illustrating how memory is split and coalesced. The `resize` function is left as an exercise for the reader. The author expresses surprise at the relative simplicity of allocators, even complex ones like mimalloc, attributing much of their complexity to multithreading management.

Ultimately, the author aims to contribute a feature to mimalloc that allows it to use pre-allocated memory and plans to delve deeper into allocator internals in the future. The code for the author's implementation is available on GitHub.
chinese_title: 分配器是拿着打字机的猴子
chinese_summary:
本文探讨如何创建一个简单的内存分配器，该分配器管理一个预先分配的内存区域，其灵感来源于 Microsoft 的 mimalloc 中的一个限制。作者幽默地表示，即使专业知识有限，构建一个基本的分配器也是可以实现的，因此有了这个标题。

核心概念围绕着理解分配器在分配、释放和重新分配内存方面的作用，模仿标准 C 库函数（如 `malloc`、`free` 和 `resize`）的功能。分配器需要解决的一个关键挑战是内存碎片，包括内部碎片（已分配块内的浪费空间）和外部碎片（分散在内存中的小的、无法使用的空闲块）。

本文重点介绍如何实现一个“伙伴系统”分配器，这是一种相对简单且可靠的方法，也被 Linux 内核所采用。该系统的工作原理是递归地将一个连续的内存块分成两半（伙伴），直到找到适合请求分配的大小。虽然有效，但这种方法可能会导致内部碎片。

作者通过一个示例解释了伙伴系统中的分配和释放，说明了内存是如何分割和合并的。`resize` 函数留给读者作为练习。作者对分配器的相对简单性感到惊讶，即使是像 mimalloc 这样复杂的分配器，作者也认为其复杂性主要归功于多线程管理。

最终，作者的目标是为 mimalloc 贡献一个允许它使用预先分配的内存的功能，并计划在未来更深入地研究分配器的内部结构。作者实现的的代码可在 GitHub 上找到。

title: Low-Temperature Additive Manufacturing of Glass
summary:
This article highlights Lincoln Laboratory's innovative approach to low-temperature additive manufacturing (3D printing) of glass, offering a significant advancement over traditional methods. Instead of requiring temperatures exceeding 1,000°C, their technique cures glass structures at only 250°C, using a custom-engineered ink composed of a silicate solution and inorganic nanoparticles.

The core of the process is direct ink writing, allowing for precise layer-by-layer construction of complex glass structures with tailored optical, chemical, and electrical properties, achieved by modifying the ink's composition. This low-temperature method overcomes limitations of traditional glass 3D printing, which suffers from high costs, specialized equipment needs, and incompatibility with temperature-sensitive materials.

The article emphasizes the advantages of this approach, including the use of readily available ink ingredients, geometric freedom in design, and the creation of stable glass structures. By solving instability issues inherent in plastic and metal composites used in conventional 3D printing, Lincoln Laboratory’s glass structures demonstrate high resolution, thermal stability, and minimal shrinkage. Potential applications include microfluidic systems, free-form optical lenses, fiber optics, and high-temperature electronic components. Current research focuses on enhancing optical clarity and expanding the range of achievable chemical and electrical properties through ink development.
chinese_title: 玻璃的低温增材制造
chinese_summary:
本文重点介绍了林肯实验室在玻璃低温增材制造（3D打印）方面的创新方法，与传统方法相比，这是一项重大进步。他们的技术无需超过1000°C的温度，仅需250°C即可固化玻璃结构，该技术采用定制工程墨水，由硅酸盐溶液和无机纳米颗粒组成。

该工艺的核心是直接墨水书写，可以通过修改墨水的成分，实现具有定制光学、化学和电气特性的复杂玻璃结构的精确逐层构建。这种低温方法克服了传统玻璃3D打印的局限性，传统玻璃3D打印存在成本高、需要专用设备以及与温度敏感材料不兼容等问题。

本文强调了这种方法的优势，包括使用容易获得的墨水成分、设计中的几何自由度以及创建稳定的玻璃结构。通过解决传统3D打印中使用的塑料和金属复合材料固有的不稳定性问题，林肯实验室的玻璃结构展示了高分辨率、热稳定性和最小收缩率。潜在的应用包括微流体系统、自由曲面光学透镜、光纤和高温电子元件。目前的研究重点是通过墨水开发来提高光学清晰度并扩大可实现的化学和电气特性范围。

title: Sound As Pure Form: Music Language Inspired by Supercollider, APL, and Forth
summary:
"Sound As Pure Form" (sapf) is a Forth-like, stack-based programming language designed for audio synthesis and manipulation, drawing inspiration from SuperCollider, APL, and Forth. It emphasizes a functional approach, using lazy, potentially infinite sequences for audio and control events, akin to APL's array operations. The language aims for concise expressive power through automatic mapping, scanning, and reduction operators, minimizing the need for explicit loops.

Key features include:

*   **Concatenative Style:** Function composition as concatenation, natural pipelining, and left-to-right function application.
*   **Minimal Syntax:** Postfix notation reduces syntactic overhead.
*   **Data Types:** Real numbers, strings, lists (streams and signals), forms (dictionaries with inheritance), functions, and mutable references (Refs).
*   **Auto-Mapping:** Built-in operators automatically map over lists, enabling operations on entire structures without manual iteration.
*   **"Each" Operator:** The `@` operator allows functions to operate on individual elements within nested lists.
*   **Forms:** Dictionaries can inherit from one or multiple other forms.
*   **Installation:** The document provides guidance on installation and setting up environment variables, including options for sample rate and prelude file.

The document also includes detailed examples of syntax and usage, including comments, numbers, strings, words, quotes, functions, lists, forms, and auto-mapping, to help users get started with sapf.
chinese_title: 纯粹形式之声：受Supercollider、APL和Forth启发的音乐语言
chinese_summary:
纯粹形式之声 (sapf) 是一种类似 Forth 的、基于堆栈的编程语言，专为音频合成和处理而设计，灵感来源于 SuperCollider、APL 和 Forth。它强调函数式方法，使用惰性的、潜在无限的序列来处理音频和控制事件，类似于 APL 的数组运算。该语言旨在通过自动映射、扫描和归约运算符来实现简洁的表达能力，从而最大限度地减少对显式循环的需求。

主要功能包括：

*   **连接式风格：** 函数组合即连接，自然管道化，以及从左到右的函数应用。
*   **极简语法：** 后缀表示法减少了语法开销。
*   **数据类型：** 实数、字符串、列表（流和信号）、形式（具有继承的字典）、函数和可变引用（Refs）。

title: Mbake – A Makefile formatter and linter, that only took 50 years
summary:
`mbake` is a Makefile formatter and linter designed to automate Makefile standardization and improve code quality. It offers features like configurable rules, CI/CD integration, a plugin architecture, and rich terminal output. Installation is available via PyPI, VSCode extension, or from source. Formatting rules cover indentation, spacing, line continuations, and `.PHONY` declarations, including smart `.PHONY` detection and auto-insertion. `mbake` intelligently analyzes recipe commands to determine if targets are phony, distinguishing them from file-creating targets. This feature helps ensure correct and complete `.PHONY` declarations.

Configuration is managed through a `~/.bake.toml` file, allowing customization of formatting rules. Examples demonstrate basic formatting, `.PHONY` auto-insertion, and CI/CD integration using GitHub Actions.

Development details include setup instructions, test execution, and code quality checks with Black, Ruff, and Mypy. The architecture is modular and plugin-based, enabling the creation of custom rules by extending the `FormatterPlugin` class. Contributions are welcomed, and the project is licensed under the MIT License. title: P-Hacking in Startups
summary:
This article highlights the problem of "p-hacking" in startups, where the pressure to ship quickly leads to flawed statistical analysis and potentially incorrect decisions based on misleading results. It details three common p-hacking scenarios and offers solutions.

First, the article discusses the issue of **multiple comparisons without correction**, where running multiple tests increases the overall probability of a false positive. The solution is to adjust the p-value threshold using methods like the Bonferroni correction to account for the number of tests performed.

Second, it addresses **reframing the metric after results are in**. This involves searching for a significant result among many metrics after the experiment is completed, inflating the chance of finding a false positive. The solution is **pre-registration**: defining and documenting success metrics *before* running the experiment.

Finally, the article covers the temptation of **running experiments until a significant result appears**. Continuously monitoring the p-value and stopping the experiment early when it dips below the threshold increases the chance of a false positive. While completely avoiding this is recommended, **sequential testing** with adjusted, stricter thresholds early on can be used responsibly.

In essence, the article advocates for greater statistical rigor in startups to avoid shipping features based on chance findings. It emphasizes pre-registration, correction for multiple comparisons, and caution against premature conclusions, ultimately leading to more reliable experimentation and better understanding of user behavior.
chinese_title: 初创公司中的P值操纵
chinese_summary:
本文重点介绍了创业公司中存在的“p值操控”问题，即为了快速发布产品而导致统计分析存在缺陷，并可能基于具有误导性的结果做出不正确的决策。文章详细介绍了三种常见的p值操控场景并提供了解决方案。

首先，文章讨论了**未校正的多重比较**问题，即运行多个测试会增加假阳性的总体概率。 解决方案是使用诸如Bonferroni校正之类的方法来调整p值阈值，以考虑执行的测试次数。

其次，它解决了**在结果出来后重新定义指标**的问题。 这涉及在实验完成后在许多指标中寻找显着结果，从而增加了发现假阳性的机会。 解决方案是**预注册**：在运行实验*之前*定义和记录成功指标。

最后，文章涵盖了**运行实验直到出现显着结果**的诱惑。 持续监视p值并在其低于阈值时提前停止实验会增加假阳性的机会。 虽然建议完全避免这种情况，但可以使用调整后的更严格阈值的**序贯检验**。

本质上，本文倡导创业公司中更严格的统计方法，以避免基于偶然发现发布功能。 它强调预注册、多重比较校正以及对过早结论的谨慎，最终带来更可靠的实验和对用户行为的更好理解。

title: Harry Brearley, the creator of stainless steel (2016)
summary:
This article chronicles the early life and career of Harry Brearley, the inventor of stainless steel. Born into poverty in Sheffield, England, the heart of steelmaking, Brearley developed a fascination with the industry from a young age, despite lacking formal education. He started working at a steel factory as a young boy and later became a bottle washer in a laboratory under the mentorship of James Taylor, who instilled in him the value of learning and craftsmanship.

Brearley dedicated himself to studying metallurgy, learning everything he could about steel. He held various positions, honing his skills in analysis and problem-solving. He collaborated with his brother Arthur and other colleagues, and he wrote prolifically on the subject.

In 1901, Brearley was hired as a chemist at Kayser, Ellison & Co., focusing on high-speed tool steels. He gained experience working with innovative methods and sought to continuously improve and experiment. In 1903, Brearley was hired by Thomas Firth & Sons to work at a steelmaking plant in Riga, Russia, as the chemist, a testament to his growing reputation and expertise in the field. Throughout his career, Brearley's passion and dedication to steel were unwavering, setting the stage for his later discovery of stainless steel.

title: Largest Wildlife Bridge Spanning 10 Lanes of CA 101 Is Nearly Complete
summary:

After three years of construction, the bridge is entering its final stages, with the application of 6,000 cubic yards of specialized soil and the planting of 5,000 native plants to create a natural habitat.

This bridge aims to reconnect the fragmented areas of the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area (SMMNRA), the country's largest urban national park, which has been bisected by freeways, isolating local wildlife. Researchers identified the Liberty Canyon area as a critical choke point for wildlife movement as far back as the 1980s. The 101 freeway was ultimately deemed a barrier to ecological health.

The project is particularly crucial for mountain lions, whose populations are threatened by limited roaming ranges, inbreeding, and vehicle collisions. The mountain lion P-22 became the poster cat for the "Save L.A. cougars" campaign. The bridge will provide access to more resources, mates, and escape routes from disasters like wildfires. title: How fast are Linux pipes anyway?
summary:
This article explores the performance of Linux pipes and how to optimize them. It starts with a simple program using `write` and `read` syscalls, achieving a throughput of only 3.5 GiB/s, significantly slower than a highly optimized FizzBuzz program using pipes.

The author uses `perf` to profile the program and identifies that a large portion of the time is spent in `pipe_write`, specifically copying pages between user and kernel memory. A Linux pipe is described as a ring buffer holding references to memory pages. The author highlights that the slowness stems from copying data twice, operating on 4KiB pages, working with potentially non-contiguous memory, and lock contention.

To improve performance, the article introduces `vmsplice` and `splice` syscalls, which move data to and from pipes without copying. Implementing `vmsplice` on the write side improves throughput to 12.7 GiB/s, and adding `splice` on the read side further increases it to 32.8 GiB/s.

Profiling again reveals that a significant portion of time is spent on locking the pipe and in `iov_iter_get_pages`, which turns the `iovecs` into `struct pages`.
chinese_title: Linux 管道到底有多快？
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了Linux管道的性能以及如何优化它们。文章首先使用`write`和`read`系统调用实现了一个简单的程序，其吞吐量仅为3.5 GiB/s，远低于高度优化的使用管道的FizzBuzz程序。

作者使用`perf`来分析该程序，并发现大部分时间都花在了`pipe_write`中，特别是用户和内核内存之间的页面复制。Linux管道被描述为一个环形缓冲区，持有对内存页面的引用。作者强调，速度慢的原因在于数据被复制两次，以4KiB页面为单位操作，处理潜在的非连续内存，以及锁竞争。

为了提高性能，文章介绍了`vmsplice`和`splice`系统调用，它们可以在不复制数据的情况下将数据移入和移出管道。在写入端实现`vmsplice`将吞吐量提高到12.7 GiB/s，并在读取端添加`splice`进一步将其提高到32.8 GiB/s。

再次分析显示，很大一部分时间花在了锁定管道以及`iov_iter_get_pages`上，后者将`iovecs`转换为`struct pages`。

title: LaborBerlin: State-of-the-Art 16mm Projector
summary:
LaborBerlin is developing a state-of-the-art, modular 16mm film projector using open-source technologies and readily available spare parts, aiming to address the increasing scarcity and unreliability of vintage projection equipment. They intend to base the projector on existing projector mechanisms and optics (Eiki, Bauer, Bell & Howell), focusing on modernizing aspects like the light source and control features to meet the demands of contemporary artists and archivists.

Phase I involved disassembling four projector models (Siemens 2000, Kodak Pageant, Hokushin SC-10, nac Analysis Projector, and Eiki RT2) to identify a suitable foundation. They initially considered three approaches: a universal upgrade kit, a model-specific upgrade, or a DIY kit. They ultimately opted to modify the Eiki RT model due to its availability, robust build, and space for modifications.

Phase II focused on finding a replacement for the traditional halogen bulb using high-density LEDs. Tests with 200W, 400W, 600W, and 800W LEDs revealed overheating issues, prompting the adoption of water cooling. An 800W LED with water cooling achieved twice the brightness of a 250W halogen bulb.

Phase III details the decision to modify the Eiki RT model to test the LED light source with a working transport mechanism.  Jan Kulka was brought in to assist with the prototype development. The goal is to focus on light and transport mechanism control within the existing projector's framework.

第三阶段详细介绍了修改Eiki RT型号的决定，目的是使用可工作的传输机制测试LED光源。Jan Kulka被请来协助原型开发。目标是在现有放映机的框架内，专注于光线和传输机制的控制。

title: Denmark's Archaeology Experiment Is Paying Off in Gold and Knowledge
summary:
Denmark's embrace of amateur metal detecting, through its "Danefæ" law, has revolutionized its understanding of its past. Unlike many European countries that restrict or prohibit the practice, Denmark allows metal detecting with landowner permission and requires the reporting of potentially historic finds. This approach has resulted in a surge of archaeological discoveries, with over 20,000 items turned in annually.

The article highlights the extraordinary find of Ole Ginnerup Schytz, who discovered a hoard of gold disks, including a bracteate with the oldest known inscription of Odin, pushing back the timeline of Odin worship by 150 years. Private detectorists like Kristen Nedergaard Dreiøe and Marie Aagaard Larsen have also made significant contributions, uncovering a large hoard of Viking gold and a cache of iron weapons, leading to the discovery of a complex of temples.

Archaeologists like Torben Trier Christiansen emphasize the value of private detectorists, considering them essential to archaeological rescue operations, especially on farmland. The metal detectorists are essentially working as volunteers who find priceless relics.

The article illustrates how this collaborative approach between the public and archaeologists has filled in gaps in Denmark's historical map, uncovering temple complexes, trade routes, and settlements that would otherwise remain unknown, making Denmark a leader in archaeological research.
chinese_title: 丹麦考古实验正收获黄金与知识

文章重点介绍了 Ole Ginnerup Schytz 的非凡发现，他发现了一批金盘，其中包括一个带有奥丁已知最早铭文的金牌，将奥丁崇拜的时间线提前了 150 年。像 Kristen Nedergaard Dreiøe 和 Marie Aagaard Larsen 这样的私人探测员也做出了重大贡献，发现了一大批维京黄金和一批铁制武器，从而发现了一个复杂的寺庙群。

这篇文章说明了公众和考古学家之间的这种合作方法如何填补了丹麦历史地图上的空白，揭示了寺庙群、贸易路线和定居点，否则这些将仍然不为人知，使丹麦成为考古研究的领导者。

title: Airpass – Easily overcome WiFi time limits
summary:
Airpass is a Mac application designed to bypass WiFi time limits imposed by networks. These networks track devices using MAC addresses. When a user exceeds the time limit and attempts to log in again, the network recognizes the device's MAC address and denies access.

Airpass circumvents this limitation by allowing users to renew (change) their device's MAC address. By presenting a new MAC address to the network, the device appears as a completely new and unknown entity. This tricks the WiFi network into granting access, effectively resetting the time limit and allowing the user to continue using the internet. In essence, Airpass masks the device's identity so it can log into the WiFi network again as a new user. The app was created by Tiago Alves while traveling.
chinese_title: Airpass – 轻松突破WiFi时长限制
chinese_summary:
Airpass是一款Mac应用程序，旨在绕过网络设置的WiFi时间限制。这些网络通过MAC地址跟踪设备。当用户超过时间限制并尝试再次登录时，网络会识别设备的MAC地址并拒绝访问。

Airpass通过允许用户更新（更改）其设备的MAC地址来规避此限制。通过向网络呈现一个新的MAC地址，设备看起来像一个全新的未知实体。这会欺骗WiFi网络授予访问权限，从而有效地重置时间限制并允许用户继续使用互联网。本质上，Airpass会伪装设备的身份，使其能够像新用户一样再次登录WiFi网络。该应用程序由Tiago Alves在旅行时创建。

title: Load Test GlassFlow for ClickHouse: Real-Time Dedup at Scale
summary:
This article details a load test of GlassFlow, an open-source streaming ETL engine designed for ClickHouse, focusing on real-time deduplication at scale. The tests aimed to address concerns about performance under high loads in real-world scenarios involving Kafka and ClickHouse pipelines.

The setup involved simulating user event data with a specific schema (event_id, user_id, name, email, created_at) and running Kafka, ClickHouse, and GlassFlow in Docker containers. The primary transformation tested was deduplication based on the `event_id` within an 8-hour window, simulating scenarios with duplicated events due to retries or glitches. The tests were conducted on a MacBook Pro, processing between 5 to 20 million records with varying levels of parallelism.

Key metrics monitored included throughput, latency, Kafka lag, and resource usage. The results showed that GlassFlow handled up to 55,000 records per second from Kafka, processing over 9,000 records per second with consistently low latency (sub-0.12ms), while maintaining stability and avoiding data loss or disordering. The performance ceiling of ~9K RPS appeared to be limited by the local machine's resources. Lag increased proportionally with ingestion rates and event volume.

The conclusion highlights GlassFlow's effectiveness for real-time stream processing with ClickHouse, demonstrating that deduplication doesn't significantly impact performance. The authors provide a link to an open-source load test repository for readers to reproduce the benchmark.

该设置包括模拟具有特定模式（event_id，user_id，name，email，created_at）的用户事件数据，并在Docker容器中运行Kafka，ClickHouse和GlassFlow。测试的主要转换是基于`event_id`的8小时窗口内的去重，模拟由于重试或故障导致的重复事件的场景。测试在MacBook Pro上进行，处理了500万到2000万条记录，并行级别各不相同。

监测的关键指标包括吞吐量、延迟、Kafka滞后和资源使用情况。结果表明，GlassFlow每秒可从Kafka处理高达55,000条记录，并以始终较低的延迟（低于0.12毫秒）处理超过每秒9,000条记录，同时保持稳定并避免数据丢失或错乱。约9K RPS的性能上限似乎受到本地机器资源的限制。滞后随着摄取率和事件量的增加而成比例增加。

title: Requiem for a Solar Plant
summary:
This article chronicles the unraveling of Invictus Solar, a renewable energy project conceived to convert cryptocurrency profits into clean energy infrastructure in a Texas Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ). The author, flush with unexpected crypto gains, aimed to leverage tax advantages (ITC and QOZ) to make the project financially viable, despite marginal pre-tax returns.

The author assembled a team, including Mr. R, an expatriate Russian with a sharp analytical mind, and contracted engineers, lawyers, and consultants. They identified the Roby parcel, a promising site with flat terrain, confirmed QOZ status, and favorable initial interconnection assessments.

However, two critical issues emerged. The actual distance to the substation via the distribution circuit was significantly longer than initially projected, requiring expensive upgrades and limiting output. Secondly, Texas's complex mineral rights laws posed a major hurdle. Mineral rights superseded surface rights, requiring waivers from multiple owners, a challenging and costly process. Securing waivers became an unexpectedly complex and expensive endeavor. One major mineral right holder, for example, refused to grant a waiver.

Despite significant investment and effort, including $589,374.34 spent on staff and contractors before construction, the interconnection study drastically reduced the plant's capacity from 4.54MW to 3MW, making the economics unfeasible. Combined with the unresolved mineral rights issues, the project was ultimately deemed unsustainable. The author, along with Mr. R, made the difficult decision to shut it down, facing a substantial financial loss and the realization that a well-intentioned vision had gone terribly wrong.

title: Scaling our observability platform by embracing wide events and replacing OTel
summary:
This article details how ClickHouse scaled their internal observability platform, LogHouse, from 19 PiB to 100 PB of uncompressed data across 500 trillion rows. Initially, they relied on OpenTelemetry (OTel) for all log collection, but found it inefficient at scale for their core ClickHouse server telemetry. OTel's parsing and marshalling of data introduced significant overhead and data loss due to resource constraints.

To address this, they developed SysEx, a specialized system for ClickHouse-to-ClickHouse data transfer. SysEx performs a direct byte-for-byte copy of data from customer ClickHouse instances' system tables to LogHouse, preserving data fidelity and eliminating unnecessary CPU overhead. This approach significantly reduced resource consumption, allowing them to handle a 20x increase in event volume using less than 10% of the CPU previously required by OTel.

The article also describes dynamic schema generation to handle evolving system table schemas, state snapshotting to capture in-memory system tables, and fleet-wide queries, leveraging SysEx to run customer diagnostic queries across their entire fleet for release analysis and support. Finally, it mentions the ClickHouse acquisition of HyperDX, leading to the adoption of ClickStack, an integrated, ClickHouse-native observability stack that replaced their Grafana-based UI with a more seamless experience for exploration, correlation, and root cause analysis.

为了解决这个问题，他们开发了SysEx，一个专门用于 ClickHouse 到 ClickHouse 数据传输的系统。SysEx 执行从客户 ClickHouse 实例的系统表到 LogHouse 的直接字节对字节的数据复制，从而保留数据保真度并消除不必要的 CPU 开销。这种方法显著降低了资源消耗，使他们能够以不到 OTel 先前所需 CPU 的 10% 来处理 20 倍的事件量增长。

title: Unexpected security footguns in Go's parsers

1.  **(Un)Marshaling Unexpected Data:** Go parsers can expose or allow modification of data developers intend to be private. Misconfigurations like using `json:"-"` incorrectly or mistakenly setting the tag to `"omitempty"` can lead to unintended data handling.

2.  **Parser Differentials:** Discrepancies between different parsers processing the same input can lead to authentication bypasses. Go's JSON parser's behavior with duplicate keys (taking the last one) and, critically, its case-insensitive key matching, create opportunities for exploitation, as other parsers may behave differently. Using unicode characters can also cause unexpected key matching.

3.  **Data Format Confusion:** (Implied, but not detailed in this excerpt.)

The article points out that these aren't theoretical issues, citing CVE-2020-16250 and vulnerabilities found in client engagements. The author also provides Semgrep rules to help detect these misconfigurations in codebases. The author emphasizes that the case-insensitive key matching is the most critical issue.
chinese_title: Go语言解析器中意料之外的安全隐患

本文重点介绍了 Go 语言 JSON、XML 和 YAML 解析器中出现的意外安全漏洞，强调了如何利用它们的行为来绕过安全控制。作者提出了三种攻击场景：

1.  **（反）序列化意外数据：** Go 解析器可能会暴露或允许修改开发者希望保密的数据。诸如错误使用 `json:"-"` 或错误地将标签设置为 `"omitempty"` 等配置错误会导致意外的数据处理。

2.  **解析器差异：** 不同解析器处理相同输入时的差异可能导致身份验证绕过。Go 的 JSON 解析器在处理重复键时的行为（取最后一个）以及关键的大小写不敏感键匹配，为利用提供了机会，因为其他解析器的行为可能不同。使用 Unicode 字符也可能导致意外的键匹配。

3.  **数据格式混淆：** （暗示，但本摘录中未详细说明。）

文章指出这些不是理论问题，并引用了 CVE-2020-16250 以及在客户端参与中发现的漏洞。作者还提供了 Semgrep 规则，以帮助检测代码库中的这些配置错误。作者强调，大小写不敏感的键匹配是最关键的问题。

title: 'Gwada negative': French scientists find new blood type in woman
summary:
A French woman from Guadeloupe is the only known person with a new blood type, named "Gwada negative," bringing the total number of recognized blood group systems to 48. The French Blood Establishment (EFS) announced the discovery, which was officially recognized by the International Society of Blood Transfusion (ISBT) in June.

The discovery began 15 years ago when the woman's blood sample showed an unusual antibody during routine pre-surgery tests. Further research was initially hampered by limited resources but was finally solved in 2019 using DNA sequencing, which revealed a genetic mutation. Medical biologist Thierry Peyrard, involved in the discovery, explained the woman inherited the mutation from both parents and is compatible only with her own blood type, making her unique.

The name "Gwada negative" was chosen to reflect the patient's Guadeloupean origin and its easy pronunciation. The EFS hopes to find others with the same blood type to improve care for patients with rare blood types. While the ABO blood group system was discovered in the early 1900s, advances in DNA sequencing have accelerated the discovery of new blood groups in recent years.

这项发现始于 15 年前，当时该女性的血样在常规术前检查中显示出一种不寻常的抗体。最初，由于资源有限，进一步的研究受到了阻碍，但最终在 2019 年通过 DNA 测序得以解决，该测序揭示了一种基因突变。参与发现的医学生物学家 Thierry Peyrard 解释说，该女性从父母双方遗传了这种突变，并且只与自己的血型相容，这使她成为独一无二的。

选择“瓜达阴性”这个名称是为了反映患者的瓜德罗普血统以及其易于发音。EFS 希望找到其他具有相同血型的人，以改善对罕见血型患者的护理。虽然 ABO 血型系统是在 20 世纪初发现的，但近年来 DNA 测序技术的进步加速了新血型的发现。

title: AllTracker: Efficient Dense Point Tracking at High Resolution
summary:
AllTracker is a novel point tracking model designed for efficient dense tracking at high resolution. Unlike existing methods limited to lower resolutions and sparse points, AllTracker can operate at 768x1024 resolution on a 40G GPU and track every pixel.

The key innovation lies in estimating the optical flow field between a query frame and all other frames within a video, using a sliding-window strategy. This allows for long-range tracking and the sharing of information across frames to resolve flows over wide time intervals. AllTracker also outputs visibility and confidence measures.

The architecture blends optical flow and point tracking techniques, using iterative inference on low-resolution grids, spatial information propagation via 2D convolutions, and temporal information propagation via pixel-aligned attention layers. The model is parameter-efficient (16M parameters) and achieves state-of-the-art point tracking accuracy. The authors highlight the importance of training on a diverse set of datasets for achieving top performance. An extensive ablation study details the most crucial aspects of the architecture and training recipe. Code and model weights are publicly available.

其关键创新在于使用滑动窗口策略估计查询帧与视频中所有其他帧之间的光流场。这实现了长程跟踪以及跨帧信息共享，从而解决较长时间间隔内的光流。AllTracker还输出可见性和置信度度量。

该架构融合了光流和点跟踪技术，利用低分辨率网格上的迭代推理、通过2D卷积进行空间信息传播以及通过像素对齐注意力层进行时间信息传播。该模型参数高效（16M参数），并实现了最先进的点跟踪精度。作者强调了在多样化数据集上进行训练对于获得最佳性能的重要性。一项广泛的消融研究详细说明了架构和训练配方中最关键的方面。代码和模型权重已公开。

title: Samsung embeds IronSource spyware app on phones across WANA

*   **Intrusive Bloatware:** AppCloud is difficult to remove, deeply integrated into the OS, and can reappear after updates.
*   **Opaque Privacy Practices:** There's no accessible privacy policy outlining data collection and usage.
*   **Data Collection:** The app allegedly collects sensitive user data, including biometric information, IP addresses, and device fingerprints.

*   Reconsider pre-installation of AppCloud in the future.

title: ARIA, the UK's Bet to Build Scientific Revolutions
summary:
This article features an interview with Ilan Gur, CEO of ARIA (Advanced Research and Invention Agency), the UK's attempt to create scientific revolutions. Often dubbed "UK DARPA," ARIA aims to drive economic growth, improve quality of life, and foster innovation by funding "big-if-true," non-consensus ideas.

Gur emphasizes that ARIA isn't a DARPA clone but is inspired by its transformative potential. ARIA's unique approach involves term-limited program directors who actively manage research teams toward specific goals. ARIA functions as a "stem cell of an R&D funding agency," taking bold bets that amplify the research system.

A key difference between ARIA and venture capital is ARIA's proactive role in "creating the wave" rather than just "surfing" existing trends. They seek to catalyze entirely new technology platforms or industries, focusing on speculative bets within "opportunity spaces."

Gur uses the example of ARIA's "Programmable Plants" initiative led by Angie Burnett to illustrate their approach. Despite skepticism from synthetic biology researchers, ARIA recognized the potential of plants as a technology platform for addressing climate change and food security at scale. They facilitate collaboration between different scientific communities.

ARIA embraces the risk of failure and focuses on pivoting and amplifying the most valuable aspects of their programs as they learn. Gur explains that exciting projects are often met with mixed reactions, and DARPA/ARIA's role is to introduce variance into the system by giving a voice to the minority opinions.
chinese_title: ARIA：英国押注科技革命

本文采访了英国高级研究与发明署（ARIA）首席执行官伊兰·古尔。ARIA是英国试图引发科学革命的机构，常被称为“英国国防高级研究计划局（DARPA）”，旨在通过资助“一旦成真，影响巨大”且非共识性的想法，来推动经济增长、改善生活质量并促进创新。

ARIA与风险投资的关键区别在于，ARIA积极主动地“创造浪潮”，而不仅仅是“驾驭”现有趋势。他们寻求催化全新的技术平台或产业，专注于“机遇空间”内的投机性押注。

古尔以ARIA由安吉·伯内特领导的“可编程植物”计划为例，说明了他们的运作方式。尽管合成生物学研究人员对此持怀疑态度，但ARIA认识到植物作为一种技术平台，具有大规模应对气候变化和粮食安全的潜力。他们促进不同科学界之间的合作。

ARIA拥抱失败的风险，并专注于在学习过程中调整和放大项目中价值最高的部分。古尔解释说，令人兴奋的项目往往会遇到不同的反应，DARPA/ARIA的作用是通过让少数意见发出声音来引入系统变异。

title: The bad boy of bar charts: William Playfair (2023)
summary:
This article profiles William Playfair (1759-1823), a Scottish inventor, spy, and scoundrel who is best known for inventing the bar chart and pie chart. The article highlights his eventful life, marked by involvement in major historical events like the French Revolution and the development of the steam engine, often in morally questionable roles.

Playfair's early life included apprenticeships and work for James Watt, but his career took a turn towards entrepreneurship and involvement in schemes that frequently resulted in failure and allegations of fraud. He was involved in the Scioto Company land scandal in the US and later imprisoned for debt in London's Fleet Prison.

Despite his questionable activities, Playfair served as a freelance secret agent for the British government, uncovering French semaphore secrets and orchestrating a counterfeiting scheme to destabilize the French government. He also attempted blackmail in his later years.

Amidst his tumultuous life, Playfair made significant contributions to data visualization. He introduced the bar chart in his 1786 "Commercial and Political Atlas," and the pie chart in his "Statistical Breviary." He also pioneered the use of line charts to represent economic data.

The article suggests Playfair's life would make for a compelling costume drama and recommends Bruce Berkowitz's book, "PLAYFAIR: The True Story of the British Secret Agent Who Changed How We See the World," as a primary source for further information.
chinese_title: 条形图坏小子：威廉·普莱费尔 (2023)

普莱费尔的早年生活包括学徒生涯和为詹姆斯·瓦特工作，但他的职业生涯转向了创业和参与各种计划，这些计划经常导致失败和欺诈指控。他参与了美国的赛欧托公司土地丑闻，后来因债务被关押在伦敦舰队监狱。

尽管他的活动存在疑问，普莱费尔还是英国政府的一名自由职业特工，他发现了法国的信号系统秘密，并策划了一个伪造计划以破坏法国政府的稳定。在他晚年，他还试图进行敲诈勒索。

在他动荡的生活中，普莱费尔对数据可视化做出了重大贡献。他在1786年的《商业和政治地图集》中引入了条形图，并在《统计概要》中引入了饼图。他还率先使用折线图来表示经济数据。

title: Debunking NIST's calculation of the Kyber-512 security level (2023)
summary:
This cr.yp.to blog post accuses NIST of a fundamental error in calculating the security level of Kyber-512, a post-quantum cryptography system slated for standardization. The author argues that NIST nonsensically *multiplied* costs that should have been *added* when estimating the attack complexity. This mistake, according to the author, significantly inflates the perceived security of Kyber-512.

The post uses the analogy of Alice and Bob painting a fence to illustrate how basic mathematical errors can occur when the semantics of the calculations are not properly understood. The author posits that NIST mistakenly treated the cost of memory access and computation within each iteration of the XYZZY attack as sequential, rather than simultaneous, inflating the total cost by multiplying the number of iterations by the cost of each iteration, instead of considering the individual components of each iteration.

The article also highlights the alleged heavy involvement of the NSA in NIST's post-quantum cryptography standardization process, citing FOIA requests and lawsuits revealing secret documents showing more NSA personnel than NIST personnel on the pqc@nist.gov team. This raises concerns about the transparency and objectivity of NIST's selection process and motives to promote the Kyber algorithm over other viable candidates like NTRU. The author argues the miscalculation was strategically important for NIST's narrative of Kyber outperforming NTRU. Overall, the post suggests a systemic issue within NIST's procedures and casts doubt on the validity of the Kyber-512 security claims.

title: Polylogarithm Values at a Golden Ratio-Based Argument
summary:
Tristen Harr's research paper introduces the complex constant ΛG1 = T + iJ, where T = 1/(2ϕ) and J = 1/(2ϕ²), with ϕ being the golden ratio. The paper demonstrates that ΛG1 is an algebraic number with a magnitude less than one, making it a valid argument for the Polylogarithm function, Lis(z).

The core of the paper lies in the investigation of Polylogarithm values at this golden ratio-based argument, specifically examining Lis(ΛG1) for integer values of s greater than or equal to 2. Through high-precision numerical evaluations for the Dilogarithm (s=2) and Trilogarithm (s=3) cases, Harr conjectures that Lis(ΛG1) is transcendental for all integers s ≥ 2. Furthermore, the conjecture extends to suggest that these values are not found within the field extension Q(π, ln(2), ϕ).

The research is motivated by possible applications in quasicrystal studies, where the golden ratio is a fundamental element. In essence, the paper explores a novel connection between Polylogarithms, the golden ratio, and the potential implications for understanding quasicrystalline structures. The author provides preliminary evidence through numerical computation and motivates further investigation into the nature of these Polylogarithm values.

title: YouTube's new anti-adblock measures
summary:
This article details YouTube's new anti-adblock measure involving "fake buffering," where videos appear to load slowly at the beginning for adblock users. The author explains that this is caused by YouTube's internal API (InnerTube) giving video streams a deliberate delay (backoff) proportional to the ad duration, about 80% of the ad's length. This is a separate issue from server-side ad insertion.

The author proposes a workaround using uBlock Origin filters to prevent ads from being served in the first place. By setting the `isInlinePlaybackNoAd` property to `true` in InnerTube requests, ads are bypassed, eliminating the fake buffering. The author discovered this property using a tool called `req2proto` to analyze YouTube's Protocol Buffers definitions.

The workaround is implemented through a Javascript filter rule that injects `isInlinePlaybackNoAd:true` into the JSON data sent to YouTube's server. However, this method only works for "warm navigations" (clicking within YouTube's single-page app). For "cold loads" (directly navigating to a video), a more drastic solution of removing initial data to force a controlled player request is suggested, but discouraged due to potential side effects like broken livestreams and page loading issues.

The article also discusses a "locker script" YouTube uses to prevent adblockers from modifying key JavaScript objects like `JSON.stringify`. The fix involves hooking `Object.assign` instead.

title: Axolotls May Hold the Key to Regrowing Limbs
summary:
This article explores the remarkable limb regeneration capabilities of axolotls and the recent scientific advancements in understanding the underlying mechanisms. Researchers genetically engineered axolotls to identify key molecular pathways, pinpointing retinoic acid (a derivative of vitamin A) as crucial for limb regeneration, determining the type of limb that needs to be regrown. The level of retinoic acid in the axolotl's arm creates a gradient, with higher concentrations near the shoulder dictating the growth of larger structures like arms, and lower concentrations near the hand resulting in fingers or toes. The enzyme CYP26B1 regulates the amount of retinoic acid in each area.

Furthermore, the gene Shox, targeted by retinoic acid, plays a significant role; its removal resulted in axolotls with short arms but normal-sized hands. Humans also possess retinoic acid and the Shox gene, suggesting the potential to unlock regenerative abilities within our own cells. While human limb regeneration is still distant, this research is a fundamental step, with potential future applications including engineered patches to reprogram cells to regenerate tissues instead of forming scar tissue after injuries. The study underscores the importance of investing in basic biological research to explore the possibilities of regenerative medicine.

title: Mathematicians hunting prime numbers discover infinite new pattern
summary:
Mathematicians have discovered a new method for identifying prime numbers using integer partitions, a concept dating back to the 18th century. Led by Ken Ono, the team identified infinitely many new criteria for determining prime numbers, offering a novel approach distinct from traditional factorization methods.

The core of their discovery lies in Diophantine equations involving partition functions. By plugging an integer (2 or larger) into these equations, mathematicians can determine if it's prime. This yields an infinite number of "prime detecting equations," essentially providing infinitely many new definitions for what it means to be prime.

The finding, published in PNAS, demonstrates an unexpected connection between the theory of partitions and prime numbers. While it doesn't solve existing problems like the twin prime or Goldbach's conjectures, it offers a new perspective and could inspire future research into algebraic and analytic properties hidden within combinatorial functions. Experts like Kathrin Bringmann suggest exploring further applications of partition functions to other mathematical structures and sequences. George Andrews praises Ono's work as innovative and potentially groundbreaking in the ongoing quest to understand prime numbers.

*   **Joker limitations:** Fitting all 150 jokers and their graphics would be impossible due to space constraints. A careful selection would be needed.
*   **Text display:** The E-Reader can't handle the amount of text needed for card descriptions, meaning the demake would likely only be playable for those familiar with the original Balatro.
*   **Sprite limitations:** The limited number of sprites would require creative workarounds using backgrounds and potentially limiting hand size and number of jokers.
*   **Decimal numbers:** The GBA's lack of native decimal support poses a problem for many jokers.

Despite these hurdles, the author believes a demake capturing Balatro's essence is achievable, though concessions would be necessary. While a full-fledged GBA cartridge version would offer some improvement, many limitations would still exist.

The author will not release the prototype without the original creator's approval, emphasizing it was a personal project and they want to respect the original game.

title: Augmented Vertex Block Descent (AVBD)
summary:
The Utah Graphics Lab introduces Augmented Vertex Block Descent (AVBD), a novel physics-based simulation method built upon the existing Vertex Block Descent. AVBD addresses limitations of its predecessor by incorporating an augmented Lagrangian formulation. This enhancement allows AVBD to handle hard constraints with infinite stiffness without causing numerical instability and significantly improves convergence when dealing with high stiffness ratios.

Specifically, AVBD enables more robust simulations of complex scenarios like rigid body contact (including stacking and friction), articulated bodies with constrained joints (including limited degrees of freedom), and stiff systems interacting with soft bodies. The method leverages a parallel GPU implementation for real-time performance and stable simulations with low iteration counts, even for millions of interacting objects.

The developers claim superior performance, convergence, and stability compared to existing state-of-the-art alternatives. They demonstrate these improvements with simulations involving collisions, various joint/attachment constraints, and springs of diverse stiffness. An online 2D demo and the source code for it are available for exploration, highlighting AVBD's ability to maintain contact constraints in situations where previous methods falter. The research is documented in publications presented at SIGGRAPH 2025, including a paper in ACM Transactions on Graphics.

title: Learn you Galois fields for great good (2023)
summary:
This article is an introduction to a series on Galois Fields (Finite Fields) and their applications in Computer Science, aimed at computer scientists without a strong background in abstract algebra. The author was motivated by the lack of accessible resources for learning Galois Fields, which often assume too much prior mathematical knowledge or oversimplify the subject.

The series aims to bridge this gap by providing a step-by-step, active learning approach with code examples in Rust. It emphasizes understanding the underlying theory and building up gradually to practical applications like Reed-Solomon and AES encryption. The core idea is that numbers are arbitrary labels, and what matters are the relationships between them when adding or multiplying. Abstract algebra provides a framework for manipulating data using mathematical operations like addition and multiplication of bytes, which are used in common algorithms.

The author plans to cover Group Theory, Field Theory, implementing GF(p) and GF(p^k), Polynomial Arithmetic, Binary Fields, CRC, Linear Algebra over Fields, Reed-Solomon encoding/decoding, AES, and possibly more advanced topics later on. The code implementations will prioritize understandability over optimization, serving as reference implementations. Readers are encouraged to implement and experiment along with the series.

title: Show HN: To-Userscript: Chrome Extension to Userscript Converter
summary:
"to-userscript" is a CLI tool and associated ecosystem for converting Chrome or Firefox browser extensions into standalone userscripts. This allows users to leverage extension functionality on platforms that don't natively support them. It handles conversion from various sources: web store URLs, direct URLs to extension files, local directories, and archives.

Key features include replacing WebExtension APIs with userscript-compatible equivalents (GM_* functions, IndexedDB), inlining assets (CSS, images, fonts), rendering extension popups/options pages in an embedded modal, emulating the background script environment, and respecting locale directories. It offers optional minification and beautification.

The tool can be installed globally via npm, pnpm, or bun, or run directly using npx, pnpm dlx, or bunx. It currently supports polyfilling several Chrome APIs including `chrome.storage`, `chrome.runtime`, `chrome.tabs`, `chrome.i18n`, `chrome.contextMenus`, `chrome.permissions`, `chrome.notifications`, and `chrome.cookies`. Planned APIs include `chrome.browserAction`, `chrome.scripting`, `chrome.identity`, and improved `chrome.permissions` and `chrome.storage` support.

The tool has commands for converting extensions, downloading extensions, and generating `@require` metadata blocks for other userscripts. A detailed architecture guide is available. The tool works best with extensions designed for specific sites rather than those intended for broad, web-wide enhancements. It addresses potential Content Security Policy (CSP) issues by suggesting Tampermonkey security setting adjustments. Contributions to implement more Chrome APIs and fix bugs are welcome.

title: Life as Slime
summary:
Thomas Moynihan's "Life as Slime" explores the historical context and contemporary relevance of the metaphor that describes life as a mere "chemical scum" on Earth. The article begins by examining 19th-century scientific beliefs about the spontaneous generation of life, contrasting them with modern understanding of the rarity and complexity of biological processes.

Early naturalists like Ferdinand von Ritgen and Lorenz Oken, unaware of Darwinian evolution, believed life emerged effortlessly from "primordial slime" (Urschleim), even speculating that complex organisms could arise spontaneously. Erasmus Darwin theorized that organic matter created Earth's geological features.

However, the article highlights how our understanding has shifted. While early thinkers saw life as overabundant, biotechnologists and astronomers now recognize its potential rarity. Artificial life research has struggled to create self-replicating organisms, and the search for extraterrestrial life has yet to yield concrete results. The author contrasts this with past assumptions, such as the once-held belief that Venus was teeming with life.

Moynihan points out that the "life as slime" comparison originated in a time when life was assumed to be commonplace. It was then used to denigrate humanity's origins. Now, given our increased awareness of the universe's vastness and the specific conditions required for life, the metaphor should be reconsidered. If life is incredibly rare, it should be appreciated as a unique and breathtaking phenomenon, not dismissed as mere "slime."
chinese_title: 史莱姆生活
chinese_summary:

像费迪南德·冯·里特根和洛伦茨·奥肯这样的早期博物学家，在不了解达尔文进化论的情况下，认为生命毫不费力地从“原始黏液”（Urschleim）中产生，甚至推测复杂的有机体可以自发产生。伊拉斯谟·达尔文则推测有机物质创造了地球的地质特征。

然而，文章强调了我们理解的转变。虽然早期的思想家认为生命过于丰富，但生物技术学家和天文学家现在认识到它的潜在稀有性。人工生命研究一直在努力创造自我复制的有机体，而对外星生命的寻找尚未产生具体结果。作者将此与过去的假设进行了对比，例如曾经认为金星充满生命的观点。

莫伊尼汉指出，“生命如黏液”的比较起源于一个假设生命普遍存在的时代。它随后被用来贬低人类的起源。现在，鉴于我们越来越意识到宇宙的浩瀚以及生命所需的特定条件，应该重新考虑这个隐喻。如果生命极其罕见，它应该被视为一种独特而令人叹为观止的现象，而不是被当作区区“黏液”而忽略。

title: Fundamental Problems of Lisp, the Cons Cell (2024)
summary:
Xah Lee's article "Fundamental Problems of Lisp, the Cons Cell" argues that Lisp's reliance on the "cons cell" as its primary list construction primitive is a significant flaw that has hindered the language's development. The author contends that representing lists as nested pairs of elements (via `cons`, `car`, and `cdr`) is a low-level, hardware-centric approach that limits list processing capabilities and forces programmers to think in terms of a two-element maximum.

Lee suggests that the proliferation of `car/cdr`-related functions and the need for "proper lists" (nested cons cells interpreted as sequential lists) complicates list manipulation, especially for tree structures. He points out the lack of a uniform high-level treatment of lists leading to inconsistent tree function development.

The article proposes remedies like enforcing "proper lists," deprecating cons-related constructs, and exposing only higher-level list functions. He criticizes the notion of cons as inherently "powerful," comparing it to assembly language.

The article explores why the cons problem was never fixed, citing historical necessity (limitations of 1960s hardware), the relatively recent popularity of lists as fundamental data structures (1990s onwards), and the fact that most list usage involves shallow nesting. Lee argues that the advent of modern languages like JavaScript and data formats like JSON have made Lisp's cons-based approach more apparent and problematic. Finally, the article notes that Clojure attempts to fix this problem by abstracting over cons cells with sequence abstractions.

chinese_summary:

Lee认为，与`car/cdr`相关的函数激增以及对“正确列表”（解释为顺序列表的嵌套cons单元）的需求，使列表操作变得复杂，尤其是在树结构方面。他指出，缺乏对列表的统一高级处理导致了不一致的树函数开发。

这篇文章提出了补救措施，例如强制执行“正确列表”，弃用与cons相关的结构，并仅公开更高级的列表函数。他批评了cons本质上“强大”的观念，将其比作汇编语言。

这篇文章探讨了为什么cons问题从未被解决，理由是历史必要性（1960年代硬件的限制）、列表作为基本数据结构相对较晚的流行（1990年代及以后），以及大多数列表使用涉及浅层嵌套。Lee认为，像JavaScript这样的现代语言和像JSON这样的数据格式的出现，使Lisp基于cons的方法更加明显和成问题。最后，这篇文章指出，Clojure试图通过使用序列抽象来抽象cons单元来解决这个问题。

title: AbsenceBench: Language models can't tell what's missing
summary:
This arXiv article (arXiv:2506.11440) introduces "AbsenceBench," a new benchmark designed to assess the ability of Large Language Models (LLMs) to detect missing information within a context. The authors, led by Harvey Yiyun Fu, argue that while LLMs excel at tasks like "Needle in a Haystack" (NIAH) where they locate specific information, they struggle to identify *omitted* information.

AbsenceBench presents LLMs with the original and edited versions of documents across three domains: numerical sequences, poetry, and GitHub pull requests. The models are then tasked with identifying the deliberately removed pieces. The experiments reveal surprisingly poor performance, even from state-of-the-art models like Claude-3.7-Sonnet, which achieved only 69.6% F1-score on contexts with an average length of 5K tokens.

The authors hypothesize that this limitation stems from the nature of Transformer attention mechanisms. These mechanisms struggle to attend to "gaps" in documents because absences do not correspond to specific keys that can be attended to. The paper highlights the stark contrast between tasks where LLMs are superhuman (NIAH) and tasks like AbsenceBench where they unexpectedly fail, underscoring a fundamental limitation in current LLM architectures. The code and data for AbsenceBench are publicly available.
chinese_title: 缺失基准：语言模型无法辨别缺失内容
chinese_summary:
这篇arXiv文章 (arXiv:2506.11440) 介绍了 "AbsenceBench"，一个旨在评估大型语言模型 (LLM) 检测上下文缺失信息能力的新基准。以傅艺昀 (Harvey Yiyun Fu) 为首的作者认为，尽管 LLM 在诸如 "大海捞针" (NIAH) 等定位特定信息的任务中表现出色，但它们难以识别 *省略* 的信息。

作者假设这种局限性源于 Transformer 注意力机制的本质。这些机制难以关注文档中的“空白”，因为缺失不对应于可以关注的特定键。该论文强调了 LLM 在表现超人的任务（NIAH）和它们意外失败的任务（如 AbsenceBench）之间的鲜明对比，突显了当前 LLM 架构中的一个基本限制。AbsenceBench 的代码和数据已公开。

title: Captain Cook's missing ship found after sinking 250 years ago
summary:
After 250 years, the remains of Captain Cook's HMS Endeavour have been located off the coast of Rhode Island. The ship, famous for being the first European vessel to reach eastern Australia (1768-1771), was later sold and renamed the Lord Sandwich. It was sunk in Newport Harbour in 1778 during the American War of Independence as part of a submerged blockage.

The Australian National Maritime Museum (ANMM) announced the finding, identifying the wreck as RI 2394 based on 25 years of archaeological research. Comparisons with historical plans revealed the ship's dimensions and features, like the unique stem scarf, align almost identically with the Endeavour's 1768 survey specifications. Archaeologist Kieran Hosty emphasized the British timbers and precise size similarities.

The Lord Sandwich served as a British troop transport and prison ship before being deliberately sunk. While valuable artifacts are unlikely to be found due to pre-sinking salvage, everything discovered indicates an 18th-century origin.

The announcement follows a preliminary 2022 report identifying the same wreck, but it was met with criticism from the Rhode Island Marine Archaeology Project (RIMAP), the research partners, who deemed the announcement "premature". Despite this dispute, ANMM has stated it is not ruling out any candidate sites.

澳大利亚国家海事博物馆（ANMM）宣布了这一发现，并根据25年的考古研究，将该残骸确认为RI 2394。与历史图纸的比较显示，该船的尺寸和特征，例如独特的船首斜接，与“努力号”1768年的测量规格几乎完全一致。考古学家基兰·霍斯蒂强调了英国木材和精确的尺寸相似性。

title: Moon Dust Not as Damaging as Thought; Study Reveals Earth's Pollutants Are Worse
summary:
A new study from the University of Technology, Sydney suggests that lunar dust may be less harmful to astronauts than previously believed, with Earth's pollutants posing a greater health risk to human lung cells. Led by Michaela B. Smith, the research published in Life Sciences in Space Research, compared the effects of lunar dust simulants and Earth-based air pollution on human lung cells in a lab environment.

The study found that while lunar dust can cause immediate irritation to the airways due to its sharp, jagged particles, it doesn't seem to pose a significant risk for chronic long-term diseases like silicosis. In contrast, Earth's urban dust triggered significant inflammation and toxicity in the tests. The lunar simulants didn't induce significant oxidative stress, a chemical process responsible for particle-related toxicity.

The findings are relevant considering past challenges faced by astronauts during NASA's Apollo missions, who experienced respiratory issues due to lunar dust brought into the landing module on their spacesuits. Although the dust caused irritation, this new research indicates that the long-term health risks associated with lunar dust are less severe than those posed by common Earth-based air pollution.

研究发现，虽然月球尘埃由于其锋利、锯齿状的颗粒会立即刺激呼吸道，但似乎不会对矽肺等慢性长期疾病构成重大风险。相比之下，地球的城市尘埃在测试中引发了显著的炎症和毒性。月球模拟物没有诱导显著的氧化应激，这是一种导致颗粒物相关毒性的化学过程。

考虑到美国国家航空航天局阿波罗任务期间宇航员面临的挑战，以及他们因航天服带入着陆舱的月球尘埃而出现的呼吸道问题，这些发现具有重要意义。虽然尘埃引起了刺激，但这项新研究表明，与月球尘埃相关的长期健康风险低于常见的地球空气污染带来的风险。

title: Avoiding the Global Lobotomy
summary:
This article argues that we are undergoing a "global lobotomy," not literally, but abstractly, through various forms of compression facilitated by modern technology and societal trends. The author contends that these processes, like a historical lobotomy, are "reducing the complexity of psychic life."

The key forms of compression identified are:

*   **Dopamine-Reward-Systems:** Social media's reliance on likes and shares creates a dopamine feedback loop, conditioning behavior and narrowing individual expression.
*   **Overton-Window-Compression:** Social media creates a narrow acceptable range of thought, discouraging opinions outside the norm through ostracization and peer pressure.
*   **Normalcy-Compression:** People self-police and monitor others, reinforcing a limited definition of "normal" that encourages conformity.
*   **Limit-Compression:** Combined, these compressions constrain individuality within a system that favors atomization and conformity.
*   **Time-Compression:** The constant barrage of fleeting media events occupies attention and prevents deeper analysis, creating a shallow and reactive present.

The author suggests practical steps to counteract this "lobotomy," including limiting phone usage, spending time in nature, critically examining thoughts and actions, meditating, reading old books, limiting screen time, and consciously separating one's own thoughts from external influences. By taking these actions, individuals can reclaim their individuality and resist the homogenizing forces of the modern world.

识别出的主要压缩形式有：

*   **多巴胺奖励系统：** 社交媒体对点赞和分享的依赖，创造了一种多巴胺反馈回路，制约着行为，并缩小了个人表达。
*   **奥弗顿之窗压缩：** 社交媒体创造了一个狭窄的可接受思想范围，通过排斥和同伴压力来阻止超出规范的观点。
*   **常态压缩：** 人们自我约束和监督他人，强化了一种有限的“常态”定义，鼓励顺从。
*   **限制压缩：** 综合来看，这些压缩限制了个人在一个有利于原子化和顺从的系统内的个性。
*   **时间压缩：** 不断涌现的短暂媒体事件占据了注意力，并阻止了更深入的分析，从而创造了一个肤浅和被动反应的现在。

作者建议采取实际步骤来对抗这种“脑叶切除术”，包括限制手机使用、花时间在大自然中、批判性地检查思想和行为、冥想、阅读旧书、限制屏幕时间，以及有意识地将自己的思想与外部影响区分开来。通过采取这些行动，个人可以重新获得他们的个性，并抵抗现代世界的同质化力量。

title: Cosmoe: BeOS Class Library on Top of Wayland
summary:
Cosmoe is a C++ UI library designed to bring the ease of use of the BeOS class library to modern Linux systems using Wayland. It prioritizes rapid app development, high multithreading for performance, and low resource usage.

Currently a source-only technology preview, Cosmoe requires compilation from its Gitlab repository and includes sample applications. Future development focuses on improving stability to eliminate crashes and achieve near-complete BeOS API compatibility. Key missing features include "offscreen" BBitmaps and BFilePanel. Some Wayland limitations prevent full feature parity. Cosmoe is licensed under the MIT license.

Cosmoe is forked from the Haiku operating system, which itself is an open-source reimplementation of BeOS. The current version is a shared library implementing the BeOS class library on Wayland, eliminating the need for supporting programs. This contrasts with "Cosmoe Classic," which was a full port of Haiku to the Linux kernel running within an SDL window. The shared library version is the primary focus for future development due to its more practical benefits.

title: Chromium Switching from Ninja to Siso
summary:
This document is a PSA (Public Service Announcement) to external Chromium developers about the build system switching from Ninja to Siso. The migration to Siso has already been completed for internal Google developers and is now being extended to external contributors.

Siso, developed by Google's Chrome Build Infra Team, is designed as a drop-in replacement for Ninja to natively support remote execution. Developers are advised to continue using autoninja, which will automatically utilize Siso after running `gn clean`. If problems arise, developers can temporarily opt out by setting `use_siso=false` in their `args.gn` file.

Reclient will be removed from Chromium by the end of September, and Ninja will become unsupported after that date. Developers are encouraged to switch to Siso before the deadline.

The move away from Ninja is driven by maintenance costs and planned build improvements integrating GN and Siso more closely (mtime-less builds, efficient build graph serialization). Maintaining compatibility with Ninja during these improvements might become difficult, potentially causing Ninja builds to stop working.

The announcement addresses concerns from downstream users like Linux distributions and projects such as Electron and CEF.  Distributions typically build from source tarballs and often avoid using pre-built binaries. Siso will be fetched via DEPS, but questions were raised about potential release processes, version pinning to Chromium releases, and the need for a Go toolchain to build Siso itself.  The announcement confirmed that Siso can perform local builds (Windows and Mac) and that ccache support would remain the same.

title: Verified dynamic programming with Σ-types in Lean
summary:
This article demonstrates how to implement and verify dynamic programming algorithms in Lean using subtypes (dependent pair types). The core idea is to embed the proof of correctness directly into the algorithm by storing not just the computed values, but also proofs that those values satisfy the desired specification within a custom data structure called `PropMap`.

The article focuses on the Bytelandian Gold Coins problem as a concrete example. It first presents a standard recursive specification `maxDollars_spec` and a naive memoized implementation using `HashMap`.  It then highlights the difficulty of directly proving the correctness of the naive memoized version due to the need to reason about HashMap invariants.

To overcome this, the article introduces subtypes and Σ-types as a way to attach logical properties to data. It defines `cell f` as a pair of values `(a,b)` with a proof that `f a = b`. Then, `PropMap` is introduced as a `HashMap` storing values of type `cell f`.  Custom `PropMap_get?` and `PropMap_insert` functions are defined to maintain the invariant that all stored values satisfy the specification.

The core of the approach is `helper`, a recursive function that computes the solution and its proof simultaneously.  Each time a value is computed, a proof is generated to show its correctness with respect to `maxDollars_spec`. This allows the final correctness proof `maxDollars_spec_correct` to be trivial, as it directly leverages the embedded proof within the algorithm's structure.

The article concludes by suggesting exercises applying the same technique to other classic DP problems: Rod Cutting, 0/1 Knapsack, and Levenshtein Distance.
chinese_title: 在Lean中用Σ-类型验证动态规划
chinese_summary:
本文演示了如何在 Lean 中使用子类型（依赖对类型）来实现和验证动态规划算法。其核心思想是将正确性证明直接嵌入到算法中，通过自定义名为 `PropMap` 的数据结构，不仅存储计算出的值，还存储这些值满足所需规范的证明。

本文以 Bytelandian 金币问题为例。首先提出了标准的递归规范 `maxDollars_spec` 和使用 `HashMap` 的简单备忘录实现。然后强调了由于需要推理 HashMap 不变量，直接证明简单备忘录版本的正确性的困难。

为了克服这个问题，本文介绍了子类型和 Σ-类型作为将逻辑属性附加到数据的方法。它将 `cell f` 定义为一对值 `(a,b)`，并带有 `f a = b` 的证明。然后，`PropMap` 被引入作为一个存储 `cell f` 类型值的 `HashMap`。定义了自定义的 `PropMap_get?` 和 `PropMap_insert` 函数来维护所有存储的值都满足规范的不变量。

该方法的核心是 `helper`，一个同时计算解决方案及其证明的递归函数。每次计算出一个值，都会生成一个证明来表明其相对于 `maxDollars_spec` 的正确性。这使得最终的正确性证明 `maxDollars_spec_correct` 变得简单，因为它直接利用了嵌入在算法结构中的证明。

文章最后建议将相同的技术应用于其他经典的 DP 问题：切割钢条、0/1 背包和莱文斯坦距离。

title: A Python-first data lakehouse
summary:
This article addresses the challenges data scientists face in moving machine learning models from prototype notebooks to production environments. Traditional solutions, like shipping notebooks directly to production or handing off prototypes to DevOps teams, have drawbacks like fragility, slowness, and siloed teams.

The article introduces a new approach leveraging two Python-first tools: **marimo** and **bauplan**. Marimo is a modern notebook that stores code as Python files, ensuring reproducibility, maintainability, and reusability. Bauplan is a cloud data platform designed for Pythonic workflows on S3, offering data versioning, declarative environments, and function execution.

The core idea is that both tools are code-first, using Python as a common language. This allows data scientists to reuse their prototype code directly in production without refactoring.  The article walks through an example using the NYC taxi dataset, demonstrating how code developed in marimo can be seamlessly integrated into a Bauplan pipeline. Bauplan handles the complexities of data storage, versioning, runtime environment, and orchestration.  Data is treated as versioned tables within S3, managed through Git-like branching.  Decorators enable turning existing Python functions into Bauplan models and DAGs.  The article emphasizes the ease of updating production pipelines by simply modifying the marimo notebook and re-running the Bauplan pipeline. The author concludes by highlighting that this approach eliminates the need for infrastructure management, manual refactoring, and complex configurations, offering a smoother transition from prototype to production.
chinese_title: 以 Python 为先的数据湖仓

本文探讨了数据科学家在将机器学习模型从原型notebook转移到生产环境时面临的挑战。传统的解决方案，如直接将notebook部署到生产环境或将原型移交给DevOps团队，都存在诸如脆弱性、速度慢以及团队孤岛等缺点。

本文介绍了一种利用两种以Python为先的工具的新方法：**marimo** 和 **bauplan**。Marimo是一个现代notebook，它将代码存储为Python文件，从而确保可重复性、可维护性和可重用性。Bauplan是一个专为S3上的Pythonic工作流程设计的云数据平台，提供数据版本控制、声明式环境和函数执行。

核心思想是，这两种工具都是代码优先的，使用Python作为通用语言。这使得数据科学家能够直接在生产环境中使用他们的原型代码，而无需重构。本文通过一个使用纽约市出租车数据集的例子，展示了如何在marimo中开发的代码可以无缝集成到Bauplan pipeline中。Bauplan处理数据存储、版本控制、运行时环境和编排的复杂性。数据被视为S3中已版本控制的表，并通过类似Git的分支进行管理。装饰器使能够将现有的Python函数转换为Bauplan模型和DAG。本文强调了通过简单地修改marimo notebook并重新运行Bauplan pipeline来轻松更新生产pipeline。作者总结道，这种方法消除了对基础设施管理、手动重构和复杂配置的需求，从而提供了从原型到生产的更平滑的过渡。

title: Open source can't coordinate?
summary:
This article argues that open source software (OSS) struggles with coordination, hindering innovation and progress. The author uses the example of the Linux desktop environment, plagued by fragmented libraries and standards due to the lack of a unified API like those found in Windows and macOS. This leads to a fragile ecosystem requiring frozen snapshots instead of seamless updates.

The author contrasts this with the success of the Language Server Protocol (LSP), attributing its impact to its mere existence rather than technical superiority. Despite JetBrains having superior IPC technology earlier, they lacked the incentive to create an open standard as it would erode their competitive advantage. Microsoft's investment in the developer ecosystem allowed them to push LSP, filling a decade-long gap in OSS coordination for IDE features.

However, the article acknowledges Linux's existence as a counterpoint. It attributes Linux's success to its centralized kernel API management and strong adherence to public interfaces. Furthermore, POSIX provided a pre-existing, external standard that allowed different operating systems like Linux, BSDs, and XNU to share a common baseline API, solving the coordination problem upfront. The author concludes that desktop Linux lacks a similar coordinating force.
chinese_title: 开源无法协同？
chinese_summary:
本文认为开源软件(OSS)在协调方面存在困难，阻碍了创新和进步。作者以Linux桌面环境为例，指出由于缺乏像Windows和macOS那样的统一API，导致其库和标准碎片化。这导致了一个脆弱的生态系统，需要冻结快照而不是无缝更新。

作者将此与语言服务器协议(LSP)的成功进行了对比，认为LSP的影响力并非源于其技术上的优越性，而是仅仅源于它的存在。尽管JetBrains早先拥有更优秀的IPC技术，但他们缺乏创建开放标准的动力，因为这会削弱他们的竞争优势。微软对开发者生态系统的投资使他们能够推动LSP，填补了OSS在IDE功能协调方面长达十年的空白。

然而，文章承认Linux的存在是一个反例。文章将Linux的成功归功于其中心化的内核API管理以及对公共接口的严格遵守。此外，POSIX提供了一个预先存在的外部标准，使得像Linux、BSDs和XNU等不同的操作系统能够共享一个共同的基线API，从而从一开始就解决了协调问题。作者总结说，桌面Linux缺乏类似的协调力量。

title: Visualizing environmental costs of war in Hayao Miyazaki's Nausicaä
summary:
Audrey Aguirre's paper, "Visualizing environmental costs of war in Hayao Miyazaki's Nausicaä," explores how the film *Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind* uses visual storytelling to emphasize the ecological and human consequences of war. While previous studies have focused on the film's narrative and character-driven anti-war and ecological themes, this paper examines the impact of visual elements like color, lighting, and body language in conveying these messages.

Aguirre argues that these visuals are not merely aesthetic choices, but crucial narrative tools that strengthen the film's anti-war themes by reflecting real-life war technologies and consequences. The paper highlights Miyazaki's focus on the often-overlooked indirect effects of warfare on the environment. It connects these themes to current real-world issues like climate change, pollution, and resource scarcity, demonstrating how the film bridges fantasy and reality to urge viewers towards a more peaceful and environmentally conscious world.

The paper references the importance of the environment through facts provided by the UN Secretary-General António Guterres and the effect that environmental damage and war can have on human populations, and finally, it notes the significant psychological effects that film imagery can have on viewers. Aguirre concludes by explaining that because animation is capable of displaying impossible imagery to deliver heavy themes, and because Miyazaki is well-known for his ability to incorporate ecological themes and commentary on war, *Nausicaä* is the perfect tool to analyze war's effects.

title: College baseball, venture capital, and the long maybe
summary:
The article draws a parallel between the experiences of raising venture capital and navigating college baseball recruiting, particularly in the current landscape of NIL money and the transfer portal. The author, a parent of a college baseball player and a venture capitalist, argues that both processes share surprising similarities.

Both involve institutions (VC firms and college coaches) making bets on the future, with irreversible opportunity costs and high stakes. Both are results-oriented, driven by the need to deliver returns or win games, while the individuals (entrepreneurs and athletes) are focused on managing their own futures.

The author explores several VC-isms and their baseball analogues: the "pitch deck" (highlight reels and stats), the "long maybe" (slow-moving, non-committal interest), the "term sheet" (college offers, often non-binding), the "preempt" (early, non-binding commitments), the "exploding offer" (time-sensitive offers), "multiple term sheets" (competing offers), "valuation overhang" (overreaching by committing to a school above your skill level), and the "down round" (transferring to a lower division). The "IPO" equates to playing Major League Baseball, a seemingly outlandish but achievable dream.

The article concludes with advice for both entrepreneurs and athletes: define your goals, keep them in mind when making decisions, and prioritize going where you are genuinely wanted. The overall message is that both venture capital and college baseball recruiting are complex and often unpredictable processes, requiring strategic thinking and a clear understanding of one's objectives.

title: Klong: A Simple Array Language
summary:
Klong is a simple array programming language, similar to K and APL, designed for manipulating lists and multi-dimensional arrays using predefined operators. It's intended as a mathematical notation rather than a general-purpose programming language.

The Klong website offers several resources for learning the language, including a Reference Manual, an introductory book on array programming in Klong, a Quick Reference for those familiar with K or APL, a short introduction for newcomers to array languages, and a comparison of Klong and K.

Users can download Klong as a compressed archive (klong20221212.tgz) containing the source code. Compilation is straightforward using a standard C compiler (ANSI C, C99) with `make` and `make test`. Installation involves copying the `kg` binary to a suitable location (e.g., /usr/local/bin) and setting the `KLONGPATH` environment variable to the `lib/` directory in the source tree. Klong programs, saved with the `.kg` extension, can be loaded using commands like `]lname` or `./kg -l name`.

For performance-critical applications, Brian Gurraci has developed KlongPy, a vectorized implementation of Klong available on GitHub.

对于性能关键型应用，Brian Gurraci 开发了 KlongPy，这是一种 Klong 的向量化实现，可在 GitHub 上找到。

title: The Brute Squad
summary:
Steve Yegge's blog post, "The Brute Squad," delves into the rapidly evolving landscape of software development due to the rise of AI-powered coding agents. He argues that traditional IDEs are becoming obsolete, replaced by "agentic coding," a console-based workflow where developers direct AI agents to write code.

Yegge describes using coding agents as addictive, comparing the experience to a slot machine with unpredictable but rewarding results. He highlights commercial options like Claude Code, Codex, and Amp, along with promising OSS agents like Cline and RooCode.

He recounts his personal experience of abandoning IDEs altogether, noting that engineers at Anthropic are also shifting away from them. He also co-authored a book with Gene Kim on "vibe coding," which is coding with AI agents.

The post emphasizes the productivity boost gained from using these agents, with "vibe coders" achieving significantly higher output compared to traditional IDE users. This disparity is causing friction within companies, leading some to consider replacing engineers unwilling to adopt agentic coding. Yegge warns that companies are prioritizing "token burn," or AI usage per developer, as a key metric for success in the AI era, implying that companies with heavy AI usage per developer will see the most success.

Yegge concludes that the rise of AI coding agents is unstoppable due to their efficiency, and those who adapt to "vibe coding" will thrive, while others may face displacement.
chinese_title: 暴徒队
chinese_summary:

title: Show HN: Nxtscape – an open-source agentic browser
